alert.note: Alert for Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 9:51PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream and river flooding caused by runoff from prior excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Meigs. * WHEN...Until 445 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 938 PM EST, the river gauge along the Shade River near Chester indicates minor flooding is occurring due to runoff from earlier rains. - The river level should continue to slowly fall over the next several hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chester. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
